page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: Herefordshire is famous for{black {and {white, timber-framed}houses but these only make up about 5% of the houses in the area. There is a large range of different types and ages of house. There are{stone farm houses}200 years or more old, with thick walls and oak doors and beams - some of them made from parts of old ships. About one quarter of the houses in the area are built of stone. The{rest}of the houses are built of{brick.}There are Victorian houses with slate roofs but about{two thirds}of the houses in the area have been built{since}the{second {World War,} many of them{bungalows. About{one third}of the houses in{Ewyas {Harold}are{council houses.}There are two sets of{old people's flats.
